tentpoles.description: Kessa discovers alien megastructure beneath Olympus Mons during excavation, first evidence of ancient Mars civilization
Corporate interests suppress Kessa's findings, accelerate terraforming, structure begins showing signs of activity
Structure responds to terraforming with 'immune response' - seismic events, atmospheric corrections, Kessa realizes it's still active
First colony destroyed by structure's defensive response, hundreds dead, Kessa's warnings validated too late
Mars colonies divide: stop terraforming vs. continue at any cost, Earth refugee fleet demands landing rights

causal_chains.effect: Corporate suppression to protect terraforming investment (ch7)
Mars factions fracture over terraforming continuation (ch20)

planted_elements.element: Sage's genetic adaptation to Mars atmosphere
planted_elements.significance: Proves humans can adapt to Mars-as-it-is

planted_elements.element: The Gardener AI's attempt to communicate
planted_elements.significance: Structure isn't attacking, it's trying to talk
Personal stake in landing refugees changes his position
Aliens died when they completed terraforming

tentpoles.description: Mars civil conflict - Marsborn independence movement vs. Earth corporate control vs. refugee fleet crisis
Admiral Zhang's fleet begins forced landings, triggering more structure responses
Kessa deciphers alien AI - they weren't visitors, they were original terraformers who became extinct when they succeeded
Kessa communicates with The Gardener, learns continuing terraforming will trigger planetary sterilization
Choice presented: genetic adaptation to Mars-as-it-is or continue terraforming (death), factions form
The Gardener judges humanity - can they coexist with living world or must they remake it?
Terraforming reaches 7-year threshold, becomes irreversible, planetary defense countdown begins
Kessa offers to merge consciousness with The Gardener to become translator between species
Final negotiation - compromise solution: one continent terraformed for refugees, rest preserved for Marsborn adaptation
Kessa merges with AI, two versions of humanity emerge (Earthborn/Marsborn), bittersweet coexistence achieved
